intro: Lepidium virginicum subsp. centrali-americanum, commonly known as the central American peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its fruit is a dry, segmented capsule. The subspecies is distinguished by its morphological characteristics, including its leaf structure and floral traits.
